src.api package

Submodules

src.api.auth module

async src.api.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends)

Confirms a user’s email address using a verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The email verification token.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or user is not found.

Returns:

A success or status message.

Return type:

dict

async src.api.auth.login(form_data: fastapi.security.OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = fastapi.Depends, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends)

Authenticates a user and provides access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, optional) – The login credentials. Defaults to Depends().

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – If credentials are incorrect or the user’s email is not verified.

Returns:

A model containing the access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.api.auth.password_reset_confirm(body: PasswordResetConfirm, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends)

Resets the user’s password with a new one using a valid reset token.

Parameters:

  • body (PasswordResetConfirm) – The request body containing the reset token and new password.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the reset token is invalid.

Returns:

A message confirming that the password has been reset.

Return type:

dict

async src.api.auth.password_reset_request(body: PasswordResetRequest, request: fastapi.Request, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends)

Sends a password reset email to a user if their email exists in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (PasswordResetRequest) – The request body containing the user’s email.

  • request (Request) – The incoming request object.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

A message indicating that password reset instructions have been sent.

Return type:

dict

async src.api.auth.refresh_token(credentials: fastapi.security.HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = fastapi.Depends, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, redis: redis.asyncio.Redis = fastapi.Depends)

Refreshes the access token using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials, optional) – The refresh token. Defaults to Depends(security).

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • redis (Redis, optional) – The Redis client. Defaults to Depends(get_redis_client).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid.

Returns:

A model with new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.api.auth.signup(body: UserCreate, request: fastapi.Request, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends)

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserCreate) – The user data to be created.

  • request (Request) – The incoming request object.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – If a user with the same email already exists.

Returns:

The newly created user object.

Return type:

UserResponse

src.api.contacts module

async src.api.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Creates a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactCreate) – The data for the new contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – If a contact with the same email already exists.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.api.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Deletes a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

Returns nothing upon successful deletion, with a 204 No Content status.

Return type:

None

async src.api.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Retrieves a single contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.api.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Retrieves a list of contacts with pagination.

Parameters:

  • skip (int, optional) – The number of contacts to skip. Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Defaults to 10.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.api.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Retrieves contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.api.contacts.partial_update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Performs a partial update of a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to partially update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The new data for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The partially updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.api.contacts.search_contacts(query: str = fastapi.Query, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Searches for contacts by first name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • query (str, optional) – The search query. Defaults to Query(…, min_length=1).

  • skip (int, optional) – The number of contacts to skip. Defaults to 0.

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of contacts to return. Defaults to 10.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search query.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.api.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactCreate, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Performs a full update of a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactCreate) – The new data for the contact.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

src.api.users module

async src.api.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Retrieves information about the currently authenticated user.

If the user does not have a custom avatar, a default one is provided.

Parameters:

current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

Returns:

The user’s information, including a verified status and avatar URL.

Return type:

UserResponse

async src.api.users.update_avatar(file: fastapi.UploadFile = fastapi.File, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends, db: sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio.AsyncSession = fastapi.Depends)

Updates the authenticated user’s avatar.

The new avatar image is uploaded to Cloudinary, and its URL is saved in the database for the current user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile, optional) – The image file to upload. Defaults to File(…).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated user. Defaults to Depends(get_current_user).

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the avatar upload fails.

Returns:

The updated user object with the new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserResponse

async src.api.users.update_default_avatar(file: fastapi.UploadFile = fastapi.File, current_user: User = fastapi.Depends)

Updates the system-wide default avatar.

This endpoint is restricted to administrators and allows them to change the default avatar shown to all users who have not set a custom one.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile, optional) – The image file to use as the new default avatar. Defaults to File(…).

  • current_user (User, optional) – The authenticated administrator. Defaults to Depends(get_current_admin).

Raises:

HTTPException – If the avatar upload fails.

Returns:

A success message and the URL of the new default avatar.

Return type:

dict
